thread.title: Ground News - Illinois tornado season off to a busy start
thread.title_full: Ground News - Illinois tornado season off to a busy start

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Illinois tornado season off to a busy start
text:
Summary by Ground News Illinois and much of the lower Great Lakes region has been in a spring-like pattern fueling tornadoes and severe weather. February was one of the warmest on record for many Midwest states, and that warmth carried over through mid-March. On a national level, the tornado count is down significantly when compared to the same time in 2023. Share menu 0 Articles 0 Articles All Left Center Right
CENTRALILLINOISPROUD Center High Factuality Illinois tornado season off to a busy start Although the calendar just flipped to spring, Illinois and much of the lower Great Lakes region has been in a spring-like pattern fueling tornadoes and severe weather. Here is a map showing preliminary and confirmed tornadoes in 2024 so far compiled by NOAA's Storm Prediction Center. There are a few things that should stand out on that map. First off, it has not been an active tornado season everywhere, only in some regions. On a national level…
